abstracts.cdata!:
Project ratings are as follows: Project
            outcome is unsatisfactory, sustainability is unlikely,
            institutional development impact is modest, Bank performance
            is unsatisfactory, and Borrower performance is
            unsatisfactory. A number of key lessons, both positive and
            negative, were learned which were summarized as follows: 1)
            Cooperation between government agencies at various levels
            was good and played an important role, especially in project
            implementation. However, the difficulty of coordination
            between the China Trust and Investment Corporation for
            Economic Development (CTICED) and the Ministry of
            Agriculture (MOA) was somewhat under-estimated. 2) The
            CTICED's role as a Project Financial Intermediary (PFI)
            caused a long drawn-out and unresolved debate over the
            entire project period. On the one hand, PFI involvement
            resulted in a much-improved project implementation
            efficiency; helped the participating state farms and
            enterprises accelerate their physical construction;
            delegation of procurement responsibility was much more
            efficient and better fit the sub-projects' actual
            needs; and loan disbursement was much faster and more
            flexible than the traditional on-lending mechanism.
            Nonetheless, it was also obvious that the unsatisfactory
            project implementation was caused fundamentally by the
            CTICED in its role as the PFI. Specifically, the fact of
            sub-project appraisal by the CTICED, focusing almost
            entirely on the evaluation of financial viability of
            sub-borrowers, jeopardized one of the project objectives;
            the CTICED's revenue-oriented business objective
            conflicted with the reform effort made by the Project
            Oversight Office established within the MOA; and the CTICED
            heavy reliance on local governments' guarantee for
            repayment of over 50 percent of all sub-loans brought
            negative impacts on project implementation in terms of
            quality control and financial risk management. 3) By
            participating in reforms at the enterprise and state farm
            level, the project has established successful reform models
            to facilitate the reform process. This, in general, brought
            about a profound positive impact on the transformation of
            enterprises and state farms from subsidized,
            government-directed, supply-driven entities to profitable,
            independent, market-oriented and demand-driven entities.

abstracts.cdata!:
The basic objectives of the State Farms
            Commercialization Project are 1) to support, accelerate, and
            catalyze enterprise reform within the state farm system with
            a line of credit to be extended through an independent
            project financial intermediary (PFI) to state farms and
            enterprises for technological modernization of existing
            production facilities or establishment of new commercial
            ventures and 2) to increase the capacity of the China Trust
            and Investment Corporation for Economic Development
            (CTICED), the PFI, to conduct long-term lending activities.
            Financing will be predominantly used by small and medium
            scale light industries, of a scale sufficient to support
            environmental pollution control technology, and linked to
            defined steps in enterprise reform in China--enterprise
            autonomy; ownership diversification, with participation of
            collectives and private and foreign-funded enterprises;
            introduction of the shareholding system; improvement of
            selected industries with advanced and new technology;
            development if marketing and distribution systems; and
            removal of social services from enterprises. The loan is
            expected to be disbursed over a five-year period. The
            complete portfolio will consist of about 50 subprojects with
            average subloans of $4.0 million.
